page.title: 15Duffield's Dairy-Stanton
page.content: We interviewed{Mr.Duffield}who told us how he bought a{milk round}of 50 gallons a day from a Mr.Brown in a nearby village some 25 years ago.The round is now 1000 gallons a day,which is 8000 pint{bottles of milk. Mr.Duffield wanted a reliable business and chose a milk round because people obviously needed milk delivered every day. The dairy has ten vans with two spare, which are powered by{propane {gas.}There are three main buildings, which are used for the vehicles and the large fridges which hold the milk which he buys already bottled from a large dairy in Ashby-de-la-Zouch. The milkmen have to get up very early to start work and arrive to load up from about 3.30am.It is very hard work for the milkmen.
